content: Can drinking alcohol warm you up in cold weather?

Actually, drinking alcohol can give you a false sense of warmth, but it doesn't actually warm you up in cold weather. Alcohol causes blood vessels to dilate, which can make you feel warmer as more blood flows to the skin's surface. However, this also causes you to lose body heat more rapidly, which can be dangerous in cold temperatures. It's important to stay warm and hydrated in cold weather, but alcohol can interfere with both of those goals.
